param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: POST
method.doc: To configure the runtime environment with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP POST command on the runtime environment resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: ps_mode
param.doc: The mode for the policy server. Valid values are local and remote.

param.name: user_registry
param.doc: The type of user registry to be configured against. Valid values are local, ldap. If the ps_mode is local, this field must be set to local. If the ps_mode is remote, this field must be set to ldap.

param.name: ldap_host
param.doc: The name of the LDAP server. This field is required unless ps_mode is local and user_registry is local.

param.name: ldap_port
param.doc: The port to be used when the system communicates with the LDAP server. This field is required unless ps_mode is local and user_registry is local.

param.name: ldap_dn
param.doc: The DN that is used when the system contacts the user registry. If the ps_mode is local and user_registry is ldap, this field is required. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: ldap_pwd
param.doc: The password for the DN. If the ps_mode is local and the user registry is remote, this field is required. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: ldap_ssl_db
param.doc: The KDB file (no path information is required) that contains the certificate that is used to communicate with the user registry. If no keyfile is provided, the SSL is not used when the system communicates with the user registry. If SSL communication is required to the LDAP server, this field is required.

param.name: ldap_ssl_label
param.doc: The label of the SSL certificate that is used when the system communicates with the user registry. This option is only valid if the ldap_ssl_db option is provided. If SSL communication is required to the LDAP server, this field is optional. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: ldap_suffix
param.doc: The LDAP suffix that is used to hold the Security Verify Access secAuthority data. This is an optional field.If the ps_mode is local and the user_registry is ldap, this field is optional. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: clean_ldap
param.doc: Whether any existing data within the LDAP server should be cleaned prior to the configuration. This field is only used if the user registry is local.

param.name: domain
param.doc: The Security Verify Access domain name. This field is required unless ps_mode is local and user_registry is local.

param.name: admin_pwd
param.doc: The security administrator's password (also known as sec_master). This field is required.

param.name: admin_cert_lifetime
param.doc: The lifetime in days for the SSL server certificate. If ps_mode is local, this field is required. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: ssl_compliance
param.doc: Specifies whether SSL is compliant with any additional computer security standard. Valid values are none, fips, sp800-131-transition, sp800-131-strict, suite-b-128, or suite-b-192. If ps_mode is local, this field is optional. Otherwise, this field is ignored.

param.name: isam_host
param.doc: The name of the host that hosts the Security Verify Access policy server. If ps_mode is remote, this field is required. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: isam_port
param.doc: The port over which communication with the Security Verify Access policy server takes place. If ps_mode is remote, this field is required. Otherwise this field is ignored.

param.name: local_interface_only
param.doc: Whether or not to configure the local policy server and user registry to listen only on localhost. Default is false if not specified. This field is ignored unless ps_mode and/or user_registry are set to local.
